books.title: Atomic Habits
books.author: James Clear
books.description: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results. An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones. No matter your goals, Atomic Habits offers a proven framework for improving every day.

books.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
books.author: Daniel Kahneman
books.description: In this international bestseller, Daniel Kahneman, winner of the Nobel Prize in Economics, takes us on a groundbreaking tour of the mind.

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: 100,000 years ago, at least six human species inhabited the earth. Today there is just one. Us. Homo sapiens. How did our species succeed in the battle for dominance?

books.title: Educated: A Memoir
books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: An unforgettable memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

books.title: Becoming
books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: In her memoir, Michelle Obama invites readers into her world, chronicling the experiences that have shaped her.

books.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
books.author: Delia Owens
books.description: For years, rumors of the "Marsh Girl" have haunted Barkley Cove, a quiet town on the North Carolina coast.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: Paulo Coelho's enchanting novel has inspired a devoted following around the world. The Alchemist tells the mystical story of Santiago.

books.title: Dune
books.author: Frank Herbert
books.description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, Dune is the story of the boy Paul Atreides, heir to a noble family tasked with ruling an inhospitable world.

books.title: The Midnight Library
books.author: Matt Haig
books.description: Between life and death there is a library, and within that library, the shelves go on forever.

books.title: Project Hail Mary
books.author: Andy Weir
books.description: Ryland Grace is the sole survivor on a desperate, last-chance mission—and if he fails, humanity and the earth itself will perish.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: Since its immediate success in 1813, Pride and Prejudice has remained one of the most popular novels in the English language.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The Great Gatsby, F. Scott Fitzgerald's third book, stands as the supreme achievement of his career.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: Among the seminal texts of the 20th century, Nineteen Eighty-Four is a rare work that grows more haunting as its futuristic purgatory becomes more real.

books.title: It Ends with Us
books.author: Colleen Hoover
books.description: Sometimes it is the one who loves you who hurts you the most. Lily hasn't always had it easy, but that's never stopped her from working hard.

books.title: Verity
books.author: Colleen Hoover
books.description: Lowen Ashleigh is a struggling writer on the brink of financial ruin when she accepts the job offer of a lifetime.

books.title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
books.author: Sarah J. Maas
books.description: Feyre's survival rests upon her ability to hunt and kill – the forest where she lives is a cold, bleak place in the long winter months.
